summary: This is a joint letter from the prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (20 Cr. 330) to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding juror selection. It lists prospective jurors agreed upon to proceed to voir dire, those agreed to be excused, and those where the defense and government have separate objections.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, addressed in the letter regarding juror selection.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which this juror selection process is being conducted.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is submitting this joint letter to the court.

connections.description: Williams, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the prosecution against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Juror Questionnaire Completion
events.description: Prospective jurors completed juror questionnaires as part of the jury selection process for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Juror Questionnaire Completion
events.description: Prospective jurors completed juror questionnaires as part of the jury selection process for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a joint letter from the prosecution and defense to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding juror selection in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial (case 20 Cr. 330).
The parties agreed on a list of 200+ prospective jurors (by number) to proceed to voir dire and another 200+ to be excused.
The defense identified 100+ prospective jurors it objected to (wanted excused) that the government did not.
The government identified 21 prospective jurors it objected to (wanted excused) that the defense did not.
The document shows the active jury selection process was underway in November 2021, just prior to the trial's commencement.
